channel.title: Installing wine without an internet connection
channel.description:
Now that I finally have Ubuntu up and running, I need to install Wine.
I [b][i]can not[/i][/b] access the internet at the moment. This is what I need Wine for. So I downloaded Wine in windows and put it on the Ubuntu desktop with a flash drive.
So now that I have a wine-0.9.53.tar.bz2 file sitting on my desktop, how do I install it through the terminal? :confused:

item.title: Installing wine without an internet connection
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

llib, what is your ISP? How did you originally connect to the internet? Ethernet? Wireless? USB2.0? If you’re using Wireless, you need to do what Rajae said, use ndiswrapper. If it’s Ethernet, you need the drivers for your router. If it’s USB, like a USB external modem, then your USB drivers may not be configured correctly. That’s just my first impression of your issue.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing wine without an internet connection

item.title: Installing wine without an internet connection
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

llib:

I can not access the internet at the moment. This is what I need Wine for.

Oh, I see why you want wine…
Wine won’t fix your internet connection. It is simply a windows emulator.

Unless you need a windows driver for the internet. You don’t use wine for that however, you should be using ndiswrapper.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing wine without an internet connection

item.title: Installing wine without an internet connection
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Hang on… how is Wine going to fix your internet?

Read full topic
item.source: Installing wine without an internet connection

item.title: Installing wine without an internet connection
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

Plug in an ethernet cord, it will make it much easier.
Without internet on linux is a nightmare imo.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing wine without an internet connection

item.title: Installing wine without an internet connection
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Put the *.deb file on a flash drive, and move it over to your Ubuntu box. (all assuming you have Ubuntu Linux)

Read full topic
item.source: Installing wine without an internet connection

item.title: Installing wine without an internet connection
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

ThugLife:

http://www.winehq.org/site/download-deb, just follow that.

That’s telling me to use wget and stuff…I don’t have internet access on Ubuntu. This is what I need Wine for.

I looked at the readme and it tells me to use
./tools/wineinstall
But that doesn’t work, it gives me an error about C compiler not being able to create executables.

Any ideas?

Read full topic
item.source: Installing wine without an internet connection
